Let the friction per sq. ft. = $F = \mu w$ and let the disc of inside radius $R_{1}$ and outside radius $R_{2}$ revolve at $r$ revs. per sec.

Hence the moment of the friction force on the disc = $F \times 2\pi r \times \frac{R_{2}^{2} - R_{1}^{2}}{2}$.
The total moment of the friction force on the disc is $M = \mu w \int_{R_{1}}^{R_{2}} r \times 2\pi r \times \frac{R_{2}^{2} - R_{1}^{2}}{2} dr$.

blocks.latex: M = \int_{R_{1}}^{R_{2}} \left( 2\pi r \times \mu w \times 2\pi r \right) dr = \frac{1}{2} \mu w (R_{2}^{2} - R_{1}^{2})
